snippet: The rebels’ establishment of a regional oil company to sell crude from oil fields and port terminals they occupy was seen as a symbolic move, but it was another escalation of tensions.
abstract: Former rebels who fought Libyan dictator Col Muammar el-Qaddafi and are now challenging Libya's shaky central government, announce the creation of their own oil company to sell crude from oil fields and port terminals they currently occupy; largely symbolic move represents escalation of tensions over country's most strategic asset.
lead_paragraph: The rebels’ establishment of a regional oil company to sell crude from oil fields and port terminals they occupy was seen as a symbolic move, but it was another escalation of tensions.

headline.main: In Challenge, Former Rebels in Libya Form Own Oil Company
headline.print_headline: In Challenge, Ex-Rebels In Libya Form Own Oil Firm

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
